etymology.description: 釒(釒) (jīn, "metal") + 戔(戔) (jiān, "small") -> denotes coinage or currency made of metal
etymology.interpretation: The character 钱(錢) (qián, "money") combines 釒(釒) (jīn, "metal"), signifying currency or coins made from metal, and 戔(戔) (jiān, "small"), indicating small or fractional amounts. This suggests money as both metal-based and divisible.
etymology.simplification: The traditional component 釒(釒) (jīn, "metal") was simplified to 钅(钅) (jīn, "metal"). The component 戔(戔) (jiān, "small") was also simplified to 戋(戋) (jiān, "small").

examples.chinese: 他花钱(他花錢)，买了新衣服(買了新衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huā qián, mǎi le xīn yīfú.
examples.english: He spent money and bought new clothes.

examples.chinese: 没有钱(沒有錢)，我们不能旅行(我們不能旅行)。
